messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:08): the type=date impl in WebKit is weird
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:10): or in Chrome, that is
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:10): It's crazy.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:11): It implements it like a number-picker.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:11): The person developing HTML5 forms support for Chrome appears to believe that it's okay to dump semi-functional behavior into releases.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:12): First no validation UI, now this.  Blech.

2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:21): hey I wanted to ask about this sandbox feature i read on the blog... What does an iframe gave to do with insecure content? Culd it nt be just anywhere other than the iframe? Unless i am missing something fundamental here...
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:28): 2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d, if your insecure content isn't in an iframe, that's what srcdoc is meant to handle.

2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:50): Here is my story, its a bit long,pls bear... I am making a chrom extension that saves pages as HTML strings and displays them later... The only way to display after safely is using dataURL scheme and then do a  location.replace(). The problem with this is it wipes out all the scripts of the previous page..
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:50): Although this protects me from some XSS rather than I use the much more vulneralble document.write()
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:51): I cant run those scripts if i use the dataURI scheme..
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:53): So Some one suggested i use sandboxing
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:54): Now what i want to understand is that if i have a an HTML string can i limit its cross-origin policy using sandbox...
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (22:56): Cause i want to use document.write() as it preserves the scripts in the head tag
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:58): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, it appears validation is now simply not enforced?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, yes, thankfully.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:58): Until they can get some real UI for it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:59): Have you seen Firefox's UI?  It's in nightlies, and it looks pretty slick.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, it sucks a bit that it comes in pieces
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:59): the outline? looks nice, yeah
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:59): I wonder what they'll do for <input type=date>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:59): but I guess that's not going to make Firefox 4
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:00): What comes in pieces?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:00): I don't think the outline is good for stuff that the user hasn't touched yet.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:00): But the UI generally looks good.  Unlike Opera's, no offense.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:01): HTML5 forms support comes in pieces
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:01): Well, as long as it falls back gracefully, it seems fine.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:01): it gets more and more painful to decide whether to use a library for a control or not at this point

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:02): I don't think it's such a big deal.  If the built-in stuff isn't good enough, use the library.  Better yet, use a library that uses whatever native stuff is available.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:03): Firefox's UI for manually-set errors is good so far, a library could use that to implement date-pickers and such seamlessly.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:09): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, there is no "diff given below" at http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9828
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:10): yeah my script fails to submit the link whenever the page has non-UTF-8 text on it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:10): not sure how to fix it
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:10): What would cause such a crazy bug?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:12): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, it's not a big deal, it just means that detection is getting more complicated over time
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:12): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, seems inevitable.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, An error occured while submitting your comment. Please let <email/> know.

2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (23:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Hey, I may seem like a noob but does the following seem reasonable. What i want to do is to maintain the javascripts in the original browsing context. Now the problem is that location.replace('NEW HTML PAGE IN STRING') would destroy that. So If I created an Iframe element and put my 'NEW HTML PAGE IN STRING' in that , along with a sandbox attrribute, it would protect me from XSS...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: yeah bugzilla is screwed right now
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:16): 2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d, I don't really know anything about those APIs, sorry.
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (23:16): Anyone else?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: i can pass you the script (perl) if you want to figure it out :-)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, no thanks, I don't do Perl.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:17): :-) even

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:18): (and also set sandbox, of course)
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (23:19): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: So you suggest I add that small iframe element to the HTML of my original browsing context?
2e73e2e1a3cc912352ef0430cd20bc0d (23:20): I am making a chrome extension so i dont need to worry about other browsers..

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:36): Presumably they also wish they didn't have as much trouble being understood by us.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:38): I try to avoid presuming things about what the a11y people want

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:39): I don't think it's much of a presumption that they want 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e to change the spec, and that they've figured out that sometimes he doesn't get what they're asking.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): from what i hear they think i'm lying when i say i don't understand
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): anyway
